member.name: T:BCnEncoder.Decoder.Options.DecoderInputOptions
member.summary: A class for the decoder input options.

member.name: P:BCnEncoder.Decoder.Options.DecoderInputOptions.DdsBc1ExpectAlpha
member.summary: The DDS file Format doesn't seem to have a standard for indicating whether a BC1 texture includes 1bit of alpha. This option will assume that all Bc1 textures contain alpha. If this option is false, but the dds header includes a DDPF_ALPHAPIXELS flag, alpha will be included. Default is true.

member.name: T:BCnEncoder.Decoder.Options.DecoderOptions
member.summary: General options for the decoder.

member.name: P:BCnEncoder.Decoder.Options.DecoderOptions.IsParallel
member.summary: Whether the blocks should be decoded in parallel. This can be much faster than single-threaded decoding, but is slow if multiple textures are being processed at the same time. When a debugger is attached, the decoder defaults to single-threaded operation to ease debugging. Default is false.
member.remarks: Parallel execution will be ignored in RawDecoders, due to minimal performance gain.

member.name: P:BCnEncoder.Decoder.Options.DecoderOptions.TaskCount
member.summary: Determines how many tasks should be used for parallel processing.

member.name: P:BCnEncoder.Decoder.Options.DecoderOutputOptions.RedAsLuminance

member.summary: General options for the encoder.

member.name: P:BCnEncoder.Encoder.Options.EncoderOptions.IsParallel
member.summary: Whether the blocks should be encoded in parallel. This can be much faster than single-threaded encoding, but is slow if multiple textures are being processed at the same time. When a debugger is attached, the encoder defaults to single-threaded operation to ease debugging. Default is true.

member.name: P:BCnEncoder.Encoder.Options.EncoderOptions.TaskCount
member.summary: Determines how many tasks should be used for parallel processing.

member.name: P:BCnEncoder.Encoder.Options.EncoderOptions.Progress
member.summary: The progress context for the operation.

member.name: T:BCnEncoder.Encoder.Options.EncoderOutputOptions
member.summary: The output options for the encoder.

member.name: P:BCnEncoder.Encoder.Options.EncoderOutputOptions.GenerateMipMaps
member.summary: Whether to generate mipMaps. Default is true.

member.name: P:BCnEncoder.Encoder.Options.EncoderOutputOptions.MaxMipMapLevel
member.summary: The maximum number of mipmap levels to generate. -1 or 0 is unbounded. Default is -1.

member.name: P:BCnEncoder.Encoder.Options.EncoderOutputOptions.Format
member.summary: The compression Format to use. Default is Bc1.

member.name: P:BCnEncoder.Encoder.Options.EncoderOutputOptions.Quality
member.summary: The Quality of the compression. Use either fast or balanced for testing. Fast can be used for near real-time encoding for most algorithms. Use bestQuality when needed. Default is balanced.

member.name: P:BCnEncoder.Encoder.Options.EncoderOutputOptions.FileFormat
member.summary: The output file Format of the data. Either Ktx or Dds. Default is Ktx.

member.name: P:BCnEncoder.Encoder.Options.EncoderOutputOptions.DdsBc1WriteAlphaFlag
member.summary: The DDS file Format doesn't seem to have a standard for indicating whether a BC1 texture includes 1bit of alpha. This option will write DDPF_ALPHAPIXELS flag to the header to indicate the presence of an alpha channel. Some programs read and write this flag, but some programs don't like it and get confused. Your mileage may vary. Default is false.

member.name: P:BCnEncoder.Encoder.Options.EncoderOutputOptions.DdsPreferDxt10Header
member.summary: When writing a dds file, always prefer using the Dxt10 header to write the compression format instead of DwFourCC.

member.summary: BC2 / DXT3 encoding with alpha. Good for sharp alpha transitions.

member.name: F:BCnEncoder.Shared.CompressionFormat.AtcInterpolatedAlpha

member.name: T:BCnEncoder.Shared.Half
member.summary: Represents a half-precision floating point number.
member.remarks:
Note: Half is not fast enought and precision is also very bad, so is should not be used for mathematical computation (use Single instead). The main advantage of Half type is lower memory cost: two bytes per number. Half is typically used in graphical applications.
Note: All functions, where is used conversion half->float/float->half, are approx. ten times slower than float->double/double->float, i.e. ~3ns on 2GHz CPU.
References: - Code retrieved from http://sourceforge.net/p/csharp-half/code/HEAD/tree/ on 2015-12-04 - Fast Half Float Conversions, Jeroen van der Zijp, link: http://www.fox-toolkit.org/ftp/fasthalffloatconversion.pdf - IEEE 754 revision, link: http://grouper.ieee.org/groups/754/

member.name: M:BCnEncoder.Shared.Half.TryParse(System.String,BCnEncoder.Shared.Half@)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a number to its System.Half equivalent. A return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed.
member.param: The string representation of the number to convert.

When this method returns, contains the System.Half number that is equivalent to the numeric value contained in value, if the conversion succeeded, or is zero if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the s parameter is null, is not a number in a valid format, or represents a number less than System.Half.MinValue or greater than System.Half.MaxValue. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if s was converted successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:BCnEncoder.Shared.Half.TryParse(System.String,System.Globalization.NumberStyles,System.IFormatProvider,BCnEncoder.Shared.Half@)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a number to its System.Half equivalent using the specified style and culture-specific format. A return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed.
member.param: The string representation of the number to convert.
A bitwise combination of System.Globalization.NumberStyles values that indicates the permitted format of value. A typical value to specify is System.Globalization.NumberStyles.Number.
An System.IFormatProvider object that supplies culture-specific parsing information about value.

When this method returns, contains the System.Half number that is equivalent to the numeric value contained in value, if the conversion succeeded, or is zero if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the s parameter is null, is not in a format compliant with style, or represents a number less than System.Half.MinValue or greater than System.Half.MaxValue. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if s was converted successfully; otherwise, false.
member.exception: style is not a System.Globalization.NumberStyles value. -or- style is the System.Globalization.NumberStyles.AllowHexSpecifier value.

member.name: F:BCnEncoder.Shared.ImageFiles.PixelFormatFlags.DdpfLuminance
member.summary: Used in some older DDS files for single channel color uncompressed data (dwRGBBitCount contains the luminance channel bit count; dwRBitMask contains the channel mask). Can be combined with DDPF_ALPHAPIXELS for a two channel DDS file.

member.name: M:BCnEncoder.Shared.MathHelper.FrExp(System.Double,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Breaks down the floating-point value x into a component m for the normalized fraction component and another term n for the exponent, such that the absolute value of m is greater than or equal to 0.5 and less than 1.0 or equal to 0, and x = m * 2n. The function stores the integer exponent n at the location to which expptr points.
member.returns: Returns the normalized fraction m. If x is 0, the function returns 0 for both the fraction and exponent. The fraction has the same sign as the argument x. The result of the function cannot have a range error.

member.name: M:BCnEncoder.Shared.MathHelper.LdExp(System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Multiplies a floating point value arg by the number 2 raised to the exp power.
